movies.title: Giftgas
movies.plot: An idealistic young chemist discovers a compound that can be used for the production of an effective deadly poisonous gas. Against his will a chemical factory begins production of the poison gas to increase the value of their shares.
movies.simplePlot: An idealistic young chemist discovers a compound that can be used for the production of an effective deadly poisonous gas. Against his will a chemical factory begins production of the poison gas to increase the value of their shares.

biography.bio: Hans Stüwe was a German singer, film and opera director, radio performer, stage and film actor. He was born in Halle (Saale), Germany, and studied music, acting and singing. As a singer he made his debut at the Stadttheater in Königsberg and moved to Berlin to play on stage. His first one was "Des Königs befehl" (1926), which made him a big star. He was the partner of Zarah Leander in "Es war eine rauschende Ballnacht" ("It Was a Gay Ballnight") (1939), "Der Weg ins Freie" ("The Way to Freedom", "Le Chemin de la liberté") (1941), "Damals" ("At That Time", "Le Foyer perdu") (1943) and "Ave Maria" (1953). He also had some good parts in "Am Brunnen vor dem Tore" (1952), "Komm zurück..." ("J'attendrai") (1953) and "Blaue Jungs" ("Seamen") (1957) made on location in Hawaii and Tahiti. He died at the age of 75 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Hans Stüwe

biography.bio: Lissy Arna was born on December 20, 1900 in Berlin, Germany as Elisabeth Arndt. She was an actress, known for Harbor Drift (1929), The Squeeker (1931) and Sous le lampadaire (1928). She was married to Hanns Schwarz. She died on January 22, 1964 in Berlin.
biography.name: Lissy Arna

biography.bio: This elegant actor of the golden age of German cinema appeared in several masterpieces, before the cameras of such inspired geniuses as Lang, Lubitsch and Murnau. Vocation had come rather late in his life, though. Abel was indeed already 33 when he made his first film. Beforehand, he had been a forester, a gardener and a shopkeeper. But one day, while watching a film with Asta Nielsen, he was struck by revelation. He decided at once to become an actor and with the help of Nielsen in person he started a fruitful screen career. He also wrote and directed a few films. He died too soon aged only 57, but having honored the German screen with his noble, dignified figure in more than a hundred pictures.
biography.name: Alfred Abel
nicknames: The Lewis Stone of German Pictures

biography.bio: Fritz Kortner was born on May 12, 1892 in Vienna, Austria-Hungary as Fritz Nathan Kohn. He was an actor and director, known for Pandora's Box (1929), La chair (1949) and The Razor's Edge (1946). He was married to Johanna Hofer. He died on July 22, 1970 in Munich, Bavaria, West Germany.
biography.name: Fritz Kortner

biography.bio: Gerhard Dammann was born on March 30, 1883 in Cologne, North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany as Heinrich Gerhard Dammann. He was an actor and director, known for Mausi (1934), Aufschnitt (1934) and Sous le lampadaire (1928). He died on February 21, 1946 in Bad Ischl, Upper Austria, Austria.
biography.name: Gerhard Dammann

biography.bio: Vera Baranovskaya was born in 1885 in St. Petersburg, Russian Empire as Vera Vsevolodovna Baranovskaya. She was an actress, known for Mother (1926), La fin de Saint-Pétersbourg (1927) and Telle est la vie (1930). She died on December 7, 1935 in Paris, France.
biography.name: Vera Baranovskaya

biography.bio: Bobby Burns is an actor, known for Bobby, der Benzinjunge (1929), Narkose (1929) and Mon coeur est un jazz band (1929).
biography.name: Bobby Burns

biography.bio: Nico Turoff was born on December 6, 1899 in Kremenchuk, Poltava Governorate, Russian Empire. He was an actor, known for Cyankali (1930), Der Ruf des Nordens (1929) and The Devious Path (1928). He died on June 22, 1978 in East Berlin, East Germany.
biography.name: Nico Turoff

biography.bio: Paul Rehkopf was born on May 21, 1872 in Brunswick, Germany. He was an actor, known for Destiny (1921), Le testament du docteur Mabuse (1933) and À quoi rêve une femme au printemps (1929). He died on June 29, 1949 in Berlin, Germany.
biography.name: Paul Rehkopf

biography.bio: Carl Goetz was born on April 10, 1862 in Vienna, Austrian Empire as Carl Perl. He was an actor, known for Pandora's Box (1929), L'expulsion (1923) and Die gelbe Gefahr (1922). He died on August 15, 1932 in Vienna, Austria.
biography.name: Carl Goetz
